page.title: 16Recreation in Buriton
page.content: Local people and visitors use cars to reach this designater area of outstanding natural beauty, where a network of 20 numbered public footpaths nad bridlepaths crisscross the mostly private owned woods, farmland and downs. Walkers enjoy extensive views with opportunities to study all forms of wild life. Others ride horses, bicycles and motorcycles. Interests conflict when motorcyclists race noisy machines down narrow lanes polluting the air and destroying the path's surface.Buriton Parish Council and Ramblers Association ensure paths are kept open and signposted. The 80 mile South Downs Way, runs from Eastbourne to Buriton and is expected to be extended to Winchester. Buriton Pond is fished under licence, all fish must be returned.There is pheasant shooting in the winter.
